main event: On May 21, 1964, four moving lights were observed in the eastern sky over Ontario, Canada.
interesting points: The lights gave off a reddish or orangish glow and had a texture similar to a Roman Candle., The sighting lasted for about 4 minutes with the leading light pulling ahead of the other three., The lights were visible between 15' and 30' from the horizon., There was no sound associated with the lights during the sighting., The lights eventually became obscured by low clouds and were reportedly impacted by unusual atmospheric conditions.
sighted object: four moving lights in the sky
witness description: campers near Lake McCoy observing the lights
